get.description: Fetch a paginated list of calls associated with a specific OpenPhone number and another number.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the OpenPhone number associated with the call.
The unique identifier of the OpenPhone user who either placed or received the call. Defaults to the workspace owner.

The phone numbers of participants involved in the call conversation, excluding your OpenPhone number. Each number should contain the country code and conform to the E.164 format. Currently limited to one-to-one (1:1) conversations only.
DEPRECATED, use "createdAfter" or "createdBefore" instead. "since" incorrectly behaves as "createdBefore" and will be removed in an upcoming release.
Filter results to only include calls created after the specified date and time, in ISO 8601 format.
Filter results to only include calls created before the specified date and time, in ISO 8601 format.
Maximum number of results to return per page.

anyOf.description: The timestamp when the call was answered in ISO 8601 format. Null if the call was not answered.
The unique identifier of the OpenPhone user who answered the incoming call. Null for outgoing calls or unanswered incoming calls.
The unique identifier of the OpenPhone user who initiated the outgoing call. Null for incoming calls.

direction.description: The direction of the call relative to the OpenPhone number.

status.description: The current status of the call.

anyOf.description: The timestamp when the call ended, in ISO 8601 format. Null if the call is ongoing or was not completed.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the call record was created, in ISO 8601 format.

duration.description: The total duration of the call in seconds.

anyOf.description: A phone number in E.164 format, including the country code.
A phone number in E.164 format, including the country code.

id.description: The unique identifier of the call.

phoneNumberId.description: The unique identifier of the OpenPhone number associated with the call.

items.description: A phone number in E.164 format, including the country code.

anyOf.description: The timestamp when the call record was last updated, in ISO 8601 format. Null if never updated.

userId.description: The unique identifier of the OpenPhone user account associated with the call.

totalItems.description: Total number of items available. ⚠️ Note: `totalItems` is not accurately returning the total number of items that can be paginated. We are working on fixing this issue.

get.description: Get a call by its unique identifier.

schema.description: Unique identifier of the call.

anyOf.description: The timestamp when the call was answered in ISO 8601 format. Null if the call was not answered.
The unique identifier of the OpenPhone user who answered the incoming call. Null for outgoing calls or unanswered incoming calls.
The unique identifier of the OpenPhone user who initiated the outgoing call. Null for incoming calls.

direction.description: The direction of the call relative to the OpenPhone number.

status.description: The current status of the call.

anyOf.description: The timestamp when the call ended, in ISO 8601 format. Null if the call is ongoing or was not completed.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the call record was created, in ISO 8601 format.

duration.description: The total duration of the call in seconds.

anyOf.description: A phone number in E.164 format, including the country code.
A phone number in E.164 format, including the country code.

id.description: The unique identifier of the call.

phoneNumberId.description: The unique identifier of the OpenPhone number associated with the call.

items.description: A phone number in E.164 format, including the country code.

anyOf.description: The timestamp when the call record was last updated, in ISO 8601 format. Null if never updated.

userId.description: The unique identifier of the OpenPhone user account associated with the call.

get.description: Retrieve a list of recordings associated with a specific call. The results are sorted chronologically, with the oldest recording segment appearing first in the list.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the call for which recordings are being retrieved.

anyOf.description: The length of the call recording in seconds. Null if the recording is not completed or the duration is unknown.

id.description: The unique identifier of the call recording.

anyOf.description: The timestamp when the recording began, in ISO 8601 format. Null if the recording hasn't started or the start time is unknown.
The current status of the call recording.
The file type of the call recording. Null if the type is not specified or is unknown.
The URL where the call recording can be accessed or downloaded. Null if the URL is not available or the recording is not accessible.

get.summary: Get a summary for a call
get.description: Retrieve an AI-generated summary of a specific call identified by its unique call ID. Call summaries are only available on OpenPhone Business plan.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the call associated with the summary.

callId.description: The unique identifier of the call to which this summary belongs.

status.description: The status of the call summary.

get.summary: Get a transcription for a call
get.description: Retrieve a detailed transcript of a specific call identified by its unique call ID. Call transcripts are only available on OpenPhone business plan.

schema.description: Unique identifier of the call associated with this transcript.

callId.description: The unique identifier of the call to which this transcript belongs.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the transcription was created, in ISO 8601 format.

content.description: The transcribed text of a specific dialogue segment.

start.description: The start time of the dialogue segment in seconds, relative to the beginning of the call.

end.description: The end time of the dialogue segment in seconds, relative to the beginning of the call.

identifier.description: The phone number of the participant who spoke during this dialogue segment.

anyOf.description: The unique identifier of the OpenPhone user who spoke during this dialogue segment. Null for external participants or if user identification is not available.

duration.description: The total duration of the transcribed call in seconds.

status.description: The status of the call transcription.

get.description: Custom contact fields enhance your OpenPhone contacts with additional information beyond standard details like name, company, role, emails and phone numbers. These user-defined fields let you capture business-specific data. While you can only create or modify these fields in OpenPhone itself, this endpoint retrieves your existing custom properties. Use this information to accurately map and include important custom data when creating new contacts via the API.

name.description: The name of the custom contact field. This name is set by users in the OpenPhone interface when the custom field is created.

key.description: The identifying key for contact custom field.

type.description: The data type of the custom contact field, determining what kind of information can be stored and how it should be formatted.

post.description: Create a contact for a workspace.

anyOf.description: The contact's company name.

name.description: The name for the contact's email address.

anyOf.description: The contact's email address.
The contact's first name.
The contact's last name.

name.description: The name of the contact's phone number.

anyOf.description: The contact's phone number.
The contact's role.

key.description: The identifying key for contact custom field.

createdByUserId.description: The unique identifier of the user who created the contact.

source.description: The contact's source. Defaults to `null` for contacts created in the UI. Defaults to `public-api` for contacts created via the public API. Cannot be one of the following reserved words: `openphone`, `device`, `csv`, `zapier`, `google-people`, `other` or start with one of the following reserved prefixes: `openphone`, `csv`.

sourceUrl.description: A link to the contact in the source system.

anyOf.description: A unique identifier from an external system that can optionally be supplied when creating a contact. This ID is used to associate the contact with records in other systems and is required for retrieving the contact later via the "List Contacts" endpoint. Ensure the `externalId` is unique and consistent across systems for accurate cross-referencing.

id.description: The unique identifier of the contact.

anyOf.description: A unique identifier from an external system that can optionally be supplied when creating a contact. This ID is used to associate the contact with records in other systems and is required for retrieving the contact later via the "List Contacts" endpoint. Ensure the `externalId` is unique and consistent across systems for accurate cross-referencing.
Indicates how the contact was created or where it originated from.
A link to the contact in the source system.
The contact's company name.

name.description: The name for the contact's email address.

anyOf.description: The contact's email address.

id.description: The unique identifier for the contact email field.

anyOf.description: The contact's first name.
The contact's last name.

name.description: The name of the contact's phone number.

anyOf.description: The contact's phone number.

id.description: The unique identifier of the contact phone number field.

anyOf.description: The contact's role.

name.description: The name of the custom contact field. This name is set by users in the OpenPhone interface when the custom field is created.

key.description: The identifying key for contact custom field.

id.description: The unique identifier for the contact custom field.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of contact creation in ISO 8601 format.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of last contact update in ISO 8601 format.

createdByUserId.description: The unique identifier of the user who created the contact.

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of contacts. You can optionally filter the results by providing external IDs and sources. When no external IDs are provided, all contacts for the organization are returned.

schema.description: Optional list of unique identifiers from an external system used to retrieve specific contacts. When provided, the result set is limited to contacts associated with the provided `externalIds`. These IDs must match those supplied during contact creation via the "Create Contacts" endpoint. When omitted, returns all contacts for the organization. Use this parameter to cross-reference and fetch contacts linked to external systems.

items.description: A unique identifier from an external system that can optionally be supplied when creating a contact. This ID is used to associate the contact with records in other systems and is required for retrieving the contact later via the "List Contacts" endpoint. Ensure the `externalId` is unique and consistent across systems for accurate cross-referencing.
Indicates how the contact was created or where it originated from.

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return per page.

id.description: The unique identifier of the contact.

anyOf.description: A unique identifier from an external system that can optionally be supplied when creating a contact. This ID is used to associate the contact with records in other systems and is required for retrieving the contact later via the "List Contacts" endpoint. Ensure the `externalId` is unique and consistent across systems for accurate cross-referencing.
Indicates how the contact was created or where it originated from.
A link to the contact in the source system.
The contact's company name.

name.description: The name for the contact's email address.

anyOf.description: The contact's email address.

id.description: The unique identifier for the contact email field.

anyOf.description: The contact's first name.
The contact's last name.

name.description: The name of the contact's phone number.

anyOf.description: The contact's phone number.

id.description: The unique identifier of the contact phone number field.

anyOf.description: The contact's role.

name.description: The name of the custom contact field. This name is set by users in the OpenPhone interface when the custom field is created.

key.description: The identifying key for contact custom field.

id.description: The unique identifier for the contact custom field.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of contact creation in ISO 8601 format.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of last contact update in ISO 8601 format.

createdByUserId.description: The unique identifier of the user who created the contact.

totalItems.description: Total number of items available. ⚠️ Note: `totalItems` is not accurately returning the total number of items that can be paginated. We are working on fixing this issue.

get.description: Fetch a paginated list of conversations of OpenPhone conversations. Can be filtered by user and/or phone numbers. Defaults to all conversations in the OpenPhone organization. Results are returned in descending order based on the most recent conversation.

schema.description: DEPRECATED, use `phoneNumbers` instead. If both `phoneNumber` and `phoneNumbers` are provided, `phoneNumbers` will be used. Filters results to only include conversations with the specified OpenPhone phone number. Can be either your OpenPhone phone number ID or the full phone number in E.164 format.

anyOf.description: A phone number in E.164 format, including the country code.

schema.description: Filters results to only include conversations with the specified OpenPhone phone numbers. Each item can be either an OpenPhone phone number ID or a full phone number in E.164 format.

anyOf.description: A phone number in E.164 format, including the country code.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the user the making the request. Used to filter results to only include the user's conversations.
Filter results to only include conversations created after the specified date and time, in ISO_8601 format.
Filter results to only include conversations created before the specified date and time, in ISO_8601 format.
Exclude inactive conversations from the results.
Filter results to only include conversations updated after the specified date and time, in ISO_8601 format.
Filter results to only include conversations updated before the specified date and time, in ISO_8601 format.
Maximum number of results to return per page.

items.description: A phone number in E.164 format, including the country code.

totalItems.description: Total number of items available. ⚠️ Note: `totalItems` is not accurately returning the total number of items that can be paginated. We are working on fixing this issue.

post.description: Send a text message from your OpenPhone number to a recipient.

content.description: The text content of the message to be sent.

phoneNumberId.description: DEPRECATED, use "from" instead. OpenPhone phone number ID to send a message from

anyOf.description: A phone number in E.164 format, including the country code.

items.description: A phone number in E.164 format, including the country code.

userId.description: The unique identifier of the OpenPhone user sending the message. If not provided, defaults to the phone number owner.

setInboxStatus.description: Used to set the status of the related OpenPhone inbox conversation. The default behavior without setting this parameter will be for the message sent to show up as an open conversation in the user's inbox. Setting the parameter to `'done'` would move the conversation to the Done inbox view.

id.description: The unique identifier of the message.

items.description: A phone number in E.164 format, including the country code.

from.description: A phone number in E.164 format, including the country code.

anyOf.description: The unique identifier of the OpenPhone phone number that the message was sent from.

direction.description: The direction of the message relative to the OpenPhone number.

userId.description: The unique identifier of the user who sent the message. Null for incoming messages.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the message was created at, in ISO 8601 format

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the message status was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

description.const: The organization does not have enough prepaid credits to send the message

get.description: Retrieve a chronological list of messages exchanged between your OpenPhone number and specified participants, with support for filtering and pagination.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the OpenPhone number used to send or receive the messages. PhoneNumberID can be retrieved via the Get Phone Numbers endpoint.
The unique identifier of the user the message was sent from.
Array of phone numbers involved in the conversation, excluding your OpenPhone number, in E.164 format.

items.description: A phone number in E.164 format, including the country code.

schema.description: DEPRECATED, use "createdAfter" or "createdBefore" instead. "since" currently behaves as "createdBefore" and will be removed in an upcoming release.
Filter results to only include messages created after the specified date and time, in ISO_8601 format.
Filter results to only include messages created before the specified date and time, in ISO_8601 format.
Maximum number of results to return per page.

id.description: The unique identifier of the message.

items.description: A phone number in E.164 format, including the country code.

from.description: A phone number in E.164 format, including the country code.

anyOf.description: The unique identifier of the OpenPhone phone number that the message was sent from.

direction.description: The direction of the message relative to the OpenPhone number.

userId.description: The unique identifier of the user who sent the message. Null for incoming messages.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the message was created at, in ISO 8601 format

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the message status was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

totalItems.description: Total number of items available. ⚠️ Note: `totalItems` is not accurately returning the total number of items that can be paginated. We are working on fixing this issue.

description.const: The organization does not have enough prepaid credits to send the message

id.description: The unique identifier of OpenPhone phone number.
